results.title: Remain
results.brief_description: In her 2018 2-channel video work Remain, Iranian born Melbourne artist Hoda Afshar works with several of the refugees who remain on Manus Island, encouraging the men to ‘re-enact their narratives with their own bodies and [gives] them autonomy to narrate their own stories’.

constellations_other.name: Seeking asylum
constellations_other.description: Chauka Please Tell Us the Time was covertly filmed on a smartphone inside the Manus Island Detention Centre and sent via WhatsApp.

results.title: Reluctant warriors - 1939
results.brief_description: A summary of events in Britain in 1939 at the beginning of World War II, including the dramatic radio announcement of the declaration of war, evacuation of children from the cities, landing of the British Expeditionary Force in France and the actual beginning of the War at sea. Narrated by Sir Michael Redgrave. Written by Peter Baylis.

results.title: reLOCATED - The Venny kids
results.brief_description: reLOCATED was a community arts project documenting the lives of residents from the Kensington Public Housing Estate who were relocated when the estate was redeveloped. Bailey and Costi’s photography, writing and audio recordings have been combined into short video works especially for the MAP project that allow us to observe instances of beauty in city life while also celebrating the multiple forms of community and history to be found in Melbourne’s inner-West. The Venny was the local playground for kids from the estate, and ‘The Venny Kids’ pays tribute to a place that has seen many happy times.

results.title: Religion and magic
results.creator_credit: Ira R. Abrams, Harry Ratner, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “Faces of culture”.
Man’s quest for meaning, coupled with the idea of an ultimate reality beyond daily existence is evident in all societies. Religion explains the unknown, provides a common purpose and values for a community, helps weave all elements of society into one design and provides world views and belief systems that give meaning to all that humanity is and does. Religions can express harmony and balance, as with the North American Indians and Balinese Hinduism. Religions can be modified as cultures interact, can descend into magic and shamanism, or, as in industrialised society be relegated to special occasions or banned altogether. Although science seems to provide answers it is said that “the cosmos looks more and more like a great thought”. Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: Relays
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Harold Young and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
Training film produced in collaboration with the US Olympic Association and the Amateur Athletics Union. Techniques to improve relay team’s performance. Looks at the responsibilities of the relay members, different types of baton passes, fixed and running starts. Narrated by Bill Slater.

results.title: Relativistic time dilation
results.creator_credit: Paul Hewitt and Kinetic Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: An animated treatment of time dilation that utilises a flash counting sequence to show the unambiguous aging of twins in different frames of reference. Using only Einstein’s postulates, but without using a single mathematical equation, the results are the same as those using the equations for the relativistic Doppler shift and the Einstein-Lorentz time dilation. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Relatives (AFC)
results.creator_credit: Archer Films, Quantum Films, Henri Safran, Basil Appleby and Antony J. Bowman
results.brief_description: Set in beautiful cattle farming country New South Wales during the 1980s, this quirky comedy drama centres around a family reunion to celebrate grandfather’s 80th birthday. Spanning three generations, the relatives all gather at the historical family homestead, some from the city and others from the country. Add to this an intruder from Czechoslovakia, lots of alcohol, family jealousies and rivalries, “dangerous” liaisons, a somewhat bewildered and bemused grandfather, and an important announcement which will affect the whole family, there can be only one outcome - disaster. Cast includes Bill Kerr, Rowena Wallace, Carol Raye, Ray Barrett and Norman Kaye. Music written and played by Norman Kaye and photography by Tom Cowan.
